commit_message:
Fix for resize vm_state stopped rollback

Whenever an instance was in vm_state stopped and was
resized the state would rollback to active after failed
resize instead of stopped. This patch adds code to check
if a resize was performed in the exception and goes to a
new function to check the previous power and vm_state to
properly rollback.

Change-Id: Ib0557ef7de88fbef90353b0de3e68710cde4ce5c
Closes-Bug: #1551703

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-15 00:17:12.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Update help text around container ACL syntax

The patch add the information about the syntax of provding read and
write access to the users within a project.

The current status is:
account:* does not work with tempauth
account does not work with keystoneauth

Furthermore, the concept of "account" is fuzzy. It could be a
"project", but even that doesn't distinguish between a project
id and a project name.

Change-Id: I4462230fe05aa4a742e825f5b6312deb93bc1170
Closes-Bug: #1587677
'}]
commit_message:
Update help text around container ACL syntax

The patch add the information about the syntax of provding read and
write access to the users within a project.

The current status is:
account:* does not work with tempauth
account does not work with keystoneauth

Furthermore, the concept of "account" is fuzzy. It could be a
"project", but even that doesn't distinguish between a project
id and a project name.

Change-Id: I4462230fe05aa4a742e825f5b6312deb93bc1170
Closes-Bug: #1587677

keystone-services.rst to the get-started-identity.rst guide, since
creating the keystone service and endpoints manually is no longer
required (bootstrap does this for us now). The remaining information
in keystone-services.rst for exporting environment variables to use
the ``openstack`` client were moved to the keystone-install.rst

installation and configuration.

Change-Id: I6be3f286daf968dddf808f0204f2b317a5f09a59
"}]
commit_message:
[install] Incorporate bootstrap into keystone content

Since the keystone-manage bootstrap command has been implemented we
can refactor our installation process to use that, instead of
creating the Identity service and endpoints manually with the
ADMIN_TOKEN.

This also includes moving a bunch of the information in
keystone-services.rst to the get-started-identity.rst guide, since
creating the keystone service and endpoints manually is no longer
required (bootstrap does this for us now). The remaining information
in keystone-services.rst for exporting environment variables to use
the ``openstack`` client were moved to the keystone-install.rst
document since that's essentially the last step of keystone's
installation and configuration.

Change-Id: I6be3f286daf968dddf808f0204f2b317a5f09a59

commit_message:
Fix gate jobs

After change Icca91c53eabf18c3109b3931ed53f70eaaaa0e56
method "image_list_detailed" returns list of "Image"
instances which inherit from
openstack_dashboard.api.base.APIResourceWrapper.
For getting "image_type" attribute we need to use "get"
method now.

Closes-bug: #1624318
Change-Id: I363ddc1bc46a1daa855d1d41920bf8a4a4df2396

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-08 15:38:10.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/horizon_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Drop horizon-package from python-memcache tags

ensure_packages from stdlib considers packages with different
tags to be different, causing duplicate resource errors
if the python-memcache package is installed with another

openstack tag.

Change-Id: If5fb537aa71f4f1558bc3c7cb519b3246fa13da2
'}]
commit_message:
Drop horizon-package from python-memcache tags

ensure_packages from stdlib considers packages with different
tags to be different, causing duplicate resource errors
if the python-memcache package is installed with another
tag.  This patch resolves this issue by moving it to a common
openstack tag.

Change-Id: If5fb537aa71f4f1558bc3c7cb519b3246fa13da2

commit_message:
Drop keystone-package from python-memcache tags

ensure_packages from stdlib considers packages with different
tags to be different, causing duplicate resource errors
if the python-memcache package is installed with another
tag.  This patch resolves this issue by moving it to a common
openstack tag.

Change-Id: Iaff81b6e951f1062abc8851938ead5a25328a9ba

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-19 16:28:18.000000000', 'files': ['ci-scripts/ansible-lint.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Fix and improve the ansible-lint gate job

Previously the linters gate job returned successfully in all cases and it only
checked the playbooks and none of the roles.

- more comprehensive ansible-lint check of the playbooks
- add check for the roles
- gate now fails in case any of the lint processes exit with non-zero
- skip known quirks like using curl and rsync directly in the repo
- default the linters tox task to python2 as ansible-lint does not
  support python3
- fix the envlist in tox.ini to allow running 'tox' without arguments

Closes-Bug: #1621405
Change-Id: Ieb28fa06a5d15665132007559f33ea8b80d83ca4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix and improve the ansible-lint gate job

Previously the linters gate job returned successfully in all cases and it only
checked the playbooks and none of the roles.

- more comprehensive ansible-lint check of the playbooks
- add check for the roles
- gate now fails in case any of the lint processes exit with non-zero
- skip known quirks like using curl and rsync directly in the repo
- default the linters tox task to python2 as ansible-lint does not
  support python3
- fix the envlist in tox.ini to allow running 'tox' without arguments

Closes-Bug: #1621405
Change-Id: Ieb28fa06a5d15665132007559f33ea8b80d83ca4

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-14 13:33:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/live_migration/hooks/utils.sh'], 'message': "Use tempest tox with regex first

This commit add regex first while running tempest tox

There is changes in way tempest tox runs tests by using the tempest run
command directly instead of some bash script.

With tempest run you specify a regex with a '--regex' parameter and to
keep backwards compatibility this is added to the tempest tox
definitions.

But in Nova tests scripts it is being used after concurrency and ends up
having a call equivalent to:

  tempest run --regex --concurrency=2 $tempest_regex

which obviously is incorrect. Simply switching the arg order should work here.

Change-Id: If0064b9e8358332972ef4a1eee8f150e66f8c50f
Needed-by: I3684fce66a799579fa68af119652cafef25a9f03
"}]
commit_message:
Use tempest tox with regex first

This commit add regex first while running tempest tox

There is changes in way tempest tox runs tests by using the tempest run
command directly instead of some bash script.

With tempest run you specify a regex with a '--regex' parameter and to
keep backwards compatibility this is added to the tempest tox
definitions.

But in Nova tests scripts it is being used after concurrency and ends up
having a call equivalent to:

  tempest run --regex --concurrency=2 $tempest_regex

which obviously is incorrect. Simply switching the arg order should work here.

Change-Id: If0064b9e8358332972ef4a1eee8f150e66f8c50f
Needed-by: I3684fce66a799579fa68af119652cafef25a9f03

commit_message:
Make sure Neutron scenario jobs are run on test file changes

Change [1] shows that the scenario jobs do not get executed if only
scenario tests files are edited, forcing the poor developer to post
dummy changes [2] to trigger the run.

This patch ensures that devstack-based jobs are skipped for unit
tests only.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/372424/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/372674/

Change-Id: I89ceef2554ae8ab7d8f0eb5e86b69b06c929c701

commit_message:
[docs] Resolve errors and simplify sphinx config

This patch does the following:

- Simplifies the sphinx configuration introduced in
  https://review.openstack.org/371722 to reduce the
  number of variables involved. The variables are
  also ordered in the same way everywhere to make it
  easier to read and troubleshoot.

- Simplifies some of the CLI guides to be more explicit
  about the tag to checkout when cloning the git repo.

- Cleaned up some references which went to non-existant
  documents.

- Added a link to the networking appendix.

- As per https://review.openstack.org/369650 the
  backup directory for the upgrade process is now
  the name of the source version the upgrade process is
  working with.

Change-Id: Iee30a32f99a66d9facb049311cadf1b9a8b2170e

commit_message:
router list if availability_zone ext not enabled

when calling router list with --long OSC expects the availability_zone
field in the response, even if this extension is not loaded:

As per the document, http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/
v2/?expanded=list-routers-detail, The availability zone(s) for the router
is available when router_availability_zone extension is enabled.

Added testcase to test router list without availability zone

Change-Id: Ic9abb06140eb310b797ade8b0463a876d8bea1b8
Closes-bug: #1622565

commit_message:
Support configdrive in iscsi deploy for whole disk images

This will work for UEFI only or BIOS only images. It will not
work for hybrid images; which are capable of boot from BIOS
and UEFI boot mode.

Partial-Bug: #1493328

Change-Id: I9a0775a147d5bac711b58b4b6cf0135ec68509f7

from 'failed' to 'error' on live-migration failure. That was landed
as change I7a0c5a32349b0d3604802d22e83a3c2dab4b1370

subject: Defer auth prompting until it is actually needed
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-08 15:34:35.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/common/client_config.py', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': 'Defer auth prompting until it is actually needed

Auth option prompting happens waaaay to early in the default
os-client-config flow, we need to defer it until adter the commands
have been parsed.  This is why ClientManager.setup_auth() exists,
as it is not called until the first attempt to connect to a server
occurs.  Commands that do not require authentication never hit this.

Also, required options were not being enforced.  By doing this we handle
when no authentication info is present, we fail on missing auth-url rather
than attempt to prompt for a password (default auth is password).

Closes-Bug: 1619274
Change-Id: Ia4eae350e6904c9eb2c8507d9b3429fe52418726
'}]
commit_message:
Defer auth prompting until it is actually needed

Auth option prompting happens waaaay to early in the default
os-client-config flow, we need to defer it until adter the commands
have been parsed.  This is why ClientManager.setup_auth() exists,
as it is not called until the first attempt to connect to a server
occurs.  Commands that do not require authentication never hit this.

Also, required options were not being enforced.  By doing this we handle
when no authentication info is present, we fail on missing auth-url rather
than attempt to prompt for a password (default auth is password).

Closes-Bug: 1619274
Change-Id: Ia4eae350e6904c9eb2c8507d9b3429fe52418726

subject: Fixes password created_at errors due to the server_default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-16 23:57:45.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/004_reset_password_created_at.py', 'keystone/common/sql/contract_repo/versions/004_reset_password_created_at.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql_model.py', 'keystone/common/sql/data_migration_repo/versions/004_reset_password_created_at.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_banned_operations.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py'], 'message': 'Fixes password created_at errors due to the server_default

Migration 002 sets the password created_at column to a TIMESTAMP type
with a server_default=sql.func.now(). There are a couple problems
that have been uncovered with this change:
* We cannot guarantee that func.now() will generate a UTC timestamp.
* For some older versions of MySQL, the default TIMESTAMP column will
automatically be updated when other columns are updated:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/timestamp-initialization.html

This patch fixes the problem by recreating the password created_at
column back to a DateTime type without a server_default:
1) Drop and recreate the created_at column
2) Update the created_at value
3) Set the created_at column as not nullable

Closes-Bug: #1621200
Change-Id: Id5c607a777afb6565d66a336028eba796e3846b2
(cherry picked from commit 32328de6e37e1f9f55d563f8a55087dc7d6f46e1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes password created_at errors due to the server_default

Migration 002 sets the password created_at column to a TIMESTAMP type
with a server_default=sql.func.now(). There are a couple problems
that have been uncovered with this change:
* We cannot guarantee that func.now() will generate a UTC timestamp.
* For some older versions of MySQL, the default TIMESTAMP column will
automatically be updated when other columns are updated:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/timestamp-initialization.html

This patch fixes the problem by recreating the password created_at
column back to a DateTime type without a server_default:
1) Drop and recreate the created_at column
2) Update the created_at value
3) Set the created_at column as not nullable

Closes-Bug: #1621200
Change-Id: Id5c607a777afb6565d66a336028eba796e3846b2
(cherry picked from commit 32328de6e37e1f9f55d563f8a55087dc7d6f46e1)

commit_message:
[placement] consolidate json handling in util module

The json deserialization and jsonschema handling in the Placement
API is similar enough throughout that there's no reason why it
shouldn't be consolidated as a utility method.

This does that, and adds unit tests to cover the method.

Change-Id: Ia4e86682d742a2b3122ae0a13f5ce0fb1f6a75b1
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

commit_message:
Add 9.1 with liberty upgrade levels

All environments which are created on the 9.1 Fuel Master node have
fuel_version is equal to 9.1. This release have to be added in
UPGRADE_LEVELS with the 'liberty' compatibility to support N+1 and N+2
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ic4cd045e6d428ce5cfed65f385a689629a232332
Closes-Bug: #1625083
(cherry picked from commit c0145127c2c520a0c97beea545a1f6dd5d0a4e31)

subject: Revert spec change for Microversions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-06 14:23:18.000000000', 'files': ['attic/v3/identity-api-v3.rst'], 'message': 'Revert spec change for Microversions

We decided to defer support for microversions until we have a change
that actually requires this.

Even though the "old style" identity spec has been moved to the
attic, we had updated this to indicate support for microversions.
So as to not cause confusion, this is now reverted.

Change-Id: I20f284fd760c3bf51b3ebfa7bd91dd64750d9685
'}]
commit_message:
Revert spec change for Microversions

We decided to defer support for microversions until we have a change
that actually requires this.

Even though the "old style" identity spec has been moved to the
attic, we had updated this to indicate support for microversions.
So as to not cause confusion, this is now reverted.

Change-Id: I20f284fd760c3bf51b3ebfa7bd91dd64750d9685

subject: Fix pylint Error:PGSQL_RECOVERY_CONFIG
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-19 15:00:45.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/service/process.py'], 'message': 'Fix pylint Error:PGSQL_RECOVERY_CONFIG

we should use pgsql_recovery_config, the method which has now been
renamed to lowercase. The earlier code used a constant (upper-case)
but in the change this one was likely missed.

pgsql_recovery_config is an @property and should be referenced as such.

This has nothing to do with case per-se, just a missing
function/variable.

Closes-Bug: #1624996
Change-Id: Icc9d794b45503340d988101fec710fae76f0b915
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pylint Error:PGSQL_RECOVERY_CONFIG

we should use pgsql_recovery_config, the method which has now been
renamed to lowercase. The earlier code used a constant (upper-case)
but in the change this one was likely missed.

pgsql_recovery_config is an @property and should be referenced as such.

This has nothing to do with case per-se, just a missing
function/variable.

Closes-Bug: #1624996
Change-Id: Icc9d794b45503340d988101fec710fae76f0b915

commit_message:
Add a new release note

Add a new reno note to specify that migration status is changed
from 'failed' to 'error' on live-migration failure. That was landed
as change I7a0c5a32349b0d3604802d22e83a3c2dab4b1370

Change-Id: I4e1693fa52bcb33b8770ec59640890abd2b911c8
Closes-bug: #1588888

commit_message:
Fix ansible-lint errors in all playbooks and roles

- add changed_when condition to each shell/command invocation
- set it to false when the command is just information gathering
- set it to true when it is a long, possibly not idempotent script
- add name to all tasks that were missing it
- use file module instead of rm/mkdir
- use command module where shell is not required

Change-Id: Iad378e80276426e047750d050ccd19d398f36162

commit_message:
Fix 3rd part gate repo injection

Place it after we update the upstream CI image to ensure the gating repo
will not interfere with the update from upstream. Also do not try to
inject into the undercloud when using overcloud as undercloud.

Change-Id: I3226cce311a43bcaedca4eef3bec262a8c0fb311

This patch introduces the CSV storlet

The CSV storlet has an functional test, but was also
tested in the context of spark-storlets

subject: Revert "Revert "Switch in Fedora 24 devstack job""
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-15 21:52:01.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Revert "Switch in Fedora 24 devstack job""

This reverts commit 89290018179b4ea042c6ee63597c03f6e22553c8.

The problems with util-linux that caused growroot not to work are
resolved in 2.28.2 [1].  This is now in Fedora 24 stable and part of
our latest builds.  I manually checked some F24 nodes provided by
nodepool and they have expanded roots.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1371761

Change-Id: Ie65720c3b5fab44180da97899a320f00d9b2286a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Switch in Fedora 24 devstack job""

This reverts commit 89290018179b4ea042c6ee63597c03f6e22553c8.

The problems with util-linux that caused growroot not to work are
resolved in 2.28.2 [1].  This is now in Fedora 24 stable and part of
our latest builds.  I manually checked some F24 nodes provided by
nodepool and they have expanded roots.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1371761

Change-Id: Ie65720c3b5fab44180da97899a320f00d9b2286a

    100 * all_tasks_finished / all_tasks_total

commit_message:
Support global progress for tasks

Calculate progress for cluster using simple formula

    100 * all_tasks_finished / all_tasks_total

It will works with custom graph too.

Change-Id: Iaea07ec19d80d5f344c8ecf434f771da7a608157
Closes-Bug: #1623937

commit_message:
Switch tox to use tempest run and deprecate bash runners

This commit switches the tox commands that run tempest to use tempest
run instead of pretty_tox.sh. Tempest run is the primary method of
running tempest moving forward so we should dogfood it where we can.
This also officially starts the deprecation timer (which was long
overdue as these were unofficially deprecated before) on the
run_tempest.sh and pretty_tox scripts as we move to having a unified
method of running things.

Partially implements bp tempest-run-cmd
Depends-On: I8786b9709584378aaf48393115dda94397e22544
Depends-On: I0529c2922242d8ed9c92ef718328e09f3ea9e05b
Depends-On: If0064b9e8358332972ef4a1eee8f150e66f8c50f
Depends-On: Ibaffa3a8568ea058d964463df4b76196c4d2bc7a
Change-Id: I3684fce66a799579fa68af119652cafef25a9f03

commit_message:
Fix Python 3 gating for tooz

The py34 jobs have been moved to Ubuntu Xenial, but there's no Python
3.4 on Xenial, therefore the jobs fail.

This patch aims at moving the job to Python 3.5 for master and beyond.

Change-Id: I09559318eb2dd188185f7e48af383ba80b8f3406

subject: Run diskimage-builder trusty tests on master
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-19 05:13:44.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Run diskimage-builder trusty tests on master

The gate-dib-dsvm-functests-ubuntu-trusty test has not been running
since the matches to skip ".*-ubuntu-trusty$" on master were put in
with Idba3883443e53567435c36dcc833b5f3988d8670.  Note dib also has a
"gate-dib-dsvm-functests-ubuntu-trusty-extras-nv" job which is the
non-voting portion of the functional tests (for nice-to-have platforms
like gentoo) -- I have tried to account for this (but it is currently
running anyway, because it doesn't match with the extra bit at the
end).

I think this is just an unfortunate case of dib already doing
multi-platform testing and having the node-type at the end of the job
name before we started to introduce Xenial.

Add this back in, as we want to test on trusty at the very least while
nodepool is building on trusty.

Change-Id: I148e24be59aa67d269b687a771468075d178ab72
'}]
commit_message:
Run diskimage-builder trusty tests on master

The gate-dib-dsvm-functests-ubuntu-trusty test has not been running
since the matches to skip ".*-ubuntu-trusty$" on master were put in
with Idba3883443e53567435c36dcc833b5f3988d8670.  Note dib also has a
"gate-dib-dsvm-functests-ubuntu-trusty-extras-nv" job which is the
non-voting portion of the functional tests (for nice-to-have platforms
like gentoo) -- I have tried to account for this (but it is currently
running anyway, because it doesn't match with the extra bit at the
end).

I think this is just an unfortunate case of dib already doing
multi-platform testing and having the node-type at the end of the job
name before we started to introduce Xenial.

Add this back in, as we want to test on trusty at the very least while
nodepool is building on trusty.

Change-Id: I148e24be59aa67d269b687a771468075d178ab72

commit_message:
Fixes the revert methods with unhandled exceptions

A number of the revert methods in our flow tasks make database
repository calls but do not handle potential exceptions.  This can
lead to the revert flow aborting at these tasks.

This patch adds exception handling to these repository calls inside
the revert methods.

Change-Id: Ia9b07890fe2c56382041175018679b87298c1b10
Closes-Bug: #1624047

commit_message:
Install os-api-ref without -e

The -e install during testing apparently will not actually replace an
existing os-api-ref with the development one (as experienced with lots
of local testing). Switching to just -U gives the desired results.

Change-Id: I7740c8f6219327bb00646a086afe114a5151b7d5

commit_message:
Validate floating IP in server['addresses'] scenario

While reviewing nova fix I03be8100155d343eb6a4ea9eda3f1498ad3fb4cf
it was noticed that when you delete a floating IP via the Nova
API which is associated to a server, and using neutron, the
server's instance_info_cache is not directly updated, which is what
populates the server.addresses field. nova-network does refresh the
info_cache when deleting an associated floating IP.

This patch adds validation to a scenario test that runs on both
nova-network and neutron to check this behavior.

Depends-On: I8a8ae8cdbe2d9d77e7f1ae94ebdf6e4ad46eaf00

Change-Id: I5f6b9754289a9e53115320132a2f6629d7f637cb
Related-Bug: #1614538

commit_message:
Refresh info_cache after deleting floating IP

When deleting a floating IP associated with Neutron's info_cache we don't
refresh the info_cache after it is deleted.
This patch makes it so the info_cache is refreshed when an associated
floating IP is deleted. If there is no info_cache associated with the
floating IP then info_cache is not refreshed.

Change-Id: I8a8ae8cdbe2d9d77e7f1ae94ebdf6e4ad46eaf00
Closes-Bug:  #1614538
(cherry picked from commit cdb9b6820dc17971bca24adfc0b56f030f0ae827)
(cherry picked from commit a832e6b2a019323fdf00e30302ad5c3c809baa21)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-14 06:46:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented by
using != operator to compare two dicts. So is
assertEqual() in testtools. assertEqual() in
testtools is able to handle dict, list, set and
so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make
the unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: Ic654af2fac37fd5c93def4e9fc0dbb2115b435a0
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented by
using != operator to compare two dicts. So is
assertEqual() in testtools. assertEqual() in
testtools is able to handle dict, list, set and
so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make
the unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: Ic654af2fac37fd5c93def4e9fc0dbb2115b435a0

Function pull_from_zanata calls check_po_files that removes po files
with less than 20 %, so do not use lower limit (8 %) for common
files, those will have been removed already. Instead raise to 30 %.

Use cleanup_po_files now also for manuals since we use the same
routines everywhere.

Change-Id: I216c3f7b78441e1dbcea9f90e69fd3ecf00419db
'}]
commit_message:
translations: Cleanup po files

Function pull_from_zanata calls check_po_files that removes po files
with less than 20 %, so do not use lower limit (8 %) for common
files, those will have been removed already. Instead raise to 30 %.

Use cleanup_po_files now also for manuals since we use the same
routines everywhere.

Change-Id: I216c3f7b78441e1dbcea9f90e69fd3ecf00419db

commit_message:
Use policy_rcd for stopping nova-api

In stable/mitaka we are facing issues because the nova-api service is already started see [1]

Debian nova package has automatically started nova-api service.
That leads problems during running nova-api under wsgi, because
port is reserved by this service from package.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/96/359396/1/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-beaker-rspec-ubuntu-trusty/473a34a/console.html#_2016-08-30_18_13_00_197045

Change-Id: I1fbac54f538a69ee41077286800c15fbc9e1c0f6
(cherry picked from commit d6d1e9020c3debb1dabd82cab692514eed8a85bb)
Depends-On: I4b8b8d212546d097cee9f4e1c7b954377ca746de

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-09-09 06:26:25.000000000', 'files': ['manila/db/api.py', 'manila/tests/db/sqlalchemy/test_api.py', 'manila/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'manila/scheduler/host_manager.py', 'manila/tests/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/estimate-provisioned-capacity-34f0d2d7c6c56621.yaml'], 'message': "Add provisioned_capacity_gb estimation

Currently 'provisioned_capacity_gb' is expected from
the drivers as part of capability reporting.
If driver does not provide it, it defaults to 'allocated_capacity_gb'.
But if driver does not provide both 'allocated_capacity_gb' and
'provisioned_capacity_gb' then 'provisioned_capacity_gb' defaults to 0.
Which affects later calculation of  'provisioned_ratio'.

Hence fixing it by summing up sizes of all the shares of
that host and taking that as 'provisioned_capacity_gb',
in such case.

Change-Id: I844d176eb6f0f5e7b0eb3cbd66c4b413b6757f51
Closes-Bug: #1606691
"}]
commit_message:
Add provisioned_capacity_gb estimation

Currently 'provisioned_capacity_gb' is expected from
the drivers as part of capability reporting.
If driver does not provide it, it defaults to 'allocated_capacity_gb'.
But if driver does not provide both 'allocated_capacity_gb' and
'provisioned_capacity_gb' then 'provisioned_capacity_gb' defaults to 0.
Which affects later calculation of  'provisioned_ratio'.

Hence fixing it by summing up sizes of all the shares of
that host and taking that as 'provisioned_capacity_gb',
in such case.

Change-Id: I844d176eb6f0f5e7b0eb3cbd66c4b413b6757f51
Closes-Bug: #1606691

commit_message:
Rename VERSIONS to UPGRADE_LEVELS

commit_message:
Fix test syntax error in devstack/lib/ironic

The test conditional was not using [[ ]] for the if statement
conditional.

We can use '&&' inside [[ ]]. So put all the tests inside the one
[[ ]] block.

Change-Id: I4c8cb7a3a49f5e00ec638bd1fd1d9eb4931b97a1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6924, 'name': 'Pradeep Kilambi', 'email': 'pkilambi@redhat.com', 'username': 'pkilambi'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-19 12:39:55.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': "MySQL Galera backports

This is a squash of 2 backports to fix Galera deployment on Liberty.

1) Enable galera replication for Mariadb 10.1

The generated galera config has to include additional settings for
galera to be active on MariaDB 10.1.
wsrep_on must be explicitely set to ON. On MariaDB 5.5, this was
implicitely set as soon as wsrep_provider was specified.
a valid wsrep_cluster_address must be configured in addition to
wsrep_on, otherwise recovery command mysqld_safe --wsrep-recover
cannot retrieve replication state, and cluster cannot be bootstrapped.
These explicit settings are backward compatible with MariaDB 5.5 since
the two variables exist in both versions of MariaDB.

Closes-Bug: 1563751
(cherry-picked from commit df343c35ce468c34b2102f0158d36017089c776d)

2) [liberty-only] mysql: never add brackets to mysql_bind_host

The patch was submitted in Newton, but we can't backport it:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/369369/
Don't add brackets on mysql_bind_host parameter in Galera config.
Having brackets from this parameter works with old version of
Galera but not newest one.
EPEL upgraded the version of Galera, so we need this change to deploy
TripleO in HA environment

Closes-Bug: #1622755
(cherry picked from commit 41b85b26718c581ea3046e4abc4b510c49ef445c)

Change-Id: I1128c560f00fb3ffee8e072f1874ad7e610ff9e0
"}]
commit_message:
MySQL Galera backports

This is a squash of 2 backports to fix Galera deployment on Liberty.

1) Enable galera replication for Mariadb 10.1

The generated galera config has to include additional settings for
galera to be active on MariaDB 10.1.
wsrep_on must be explicitely set to ON. On MariaDB 5.5, this was
implicitely set as soon as wsrep_provider was specified.
a valid wsrep_cluster_address must be configured in addition to
wsrep_on, otherwise recovery command mysqld_safe --wsrep-recover
cannot retrieve replication state, and cluster cannot be bootstrapped.
These explicit settings are backward compatible with MariaDB 5.5 since
the two variables exist in both versions of MariaDB.

Closes-Bug: 1563751
(cherry-picked from commit df343c35ce468c34b2102f0158d36017089c776d)

2) [liberty-only] mysql: never add brackets to mysql_bind_host

The patch was submitted in Newton, but we can't backport it:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/369369/
Don't add brackets on mysql_bind_host parameter in Galera config.
Having brackets from this parameter works with old version of
Galera but not newest one.
EPEL upgraded the version of Galera, so we need this change to deploy
TripleO in HA environment

Closes-Bug: #1622755
(cherry picked from commit 41b85b26718c581ea3046e4abc4b510c49ef445c)

Change-Id: I1128c560f00fb3ffee8e072f1874ad7e610ff9e0

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-09-19 10:48:36.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_2.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_migrations.sh'], 'message': 'Add a function to upgrade from full HA to NG HA

This is the initial work to have a function that migrates a full HA
architecture as deployed in Mitaka to the HA architecture as deployed in
Newton where only a few resources are managed by pacemaker.

The sequence is the following:
1) We remove the desired services from pacemaker's control. The services
   at this point are still running normally via the systemd service as
   invoked by pacemaker
2) We do a "systemctl stop <service>" on all controllers for all the
   services that were removed from pacemaker's control. We do this to make
   sure that during the yum upgrade, the %post sections that call
   "systemctl try-restart" do not take ages, because at this point during
   the upgrade rabbit is down. The only exceptions are "openstack-core"
   and "delay" which are dummy pacemaker resources that do not exist on
   the system
3) We do a "systemctl start <service>" on all nodes for all the services
   mentioned above.

We should probably merge this patch only when newton has branched as it
is very specific to the M/N upgrade.

Closes-Bug: 1617520
Change-Id: I4c409ce58c1a57b6e0decc3cf168b62698b32e39
'}]
commit_message:
Add a function to upgrade from full HA to NG HA

This is the initial work to have a function that migrates a full HA
architecture as deployed in Mitaka to the HA architecture as deployed in
Newton where only a few resources are managed by pacemaker.

The sequence is the following:
1) We remove the desired services from pacemaker's control. The services
   at this point are still running normally via the systemd service as
   invoked by pacemaker
2) We do a "systemctl stop <service>" on all controllers for all the
   services that were removed from pacemaker's control. We do this to make
   sure that during the yum upgrade, the %post sections that call
   "systemctl try-restart" do not take ages, because at this point during
   the upgrade rabbit is down. The only exceptions are "openstack-core"
   and "delay" which are dummy pacemaker resources that do not exist on
   the system
3) We do a "systemctl start <service>" on all nodes for all the services
   mentioned above.

We should probably merge this patch only when newton has branched as it
is very specific to the M/N upgrade.

Closes-Bug: 1617520
Change-Id: I4c409ce58c1a57b6e0decc3cf168b62698b32e39

commit_message:
Check the result of the parent action when subclassing

If the parent action fails, it returns a Result instance with the
error information. We should just return that. It is possible we
could solve this in a more elegant way with exceptions.

Change-Id: I4a84eb70bb6577e67069df8150ec5b73a493af5a
Closes-Bug: #1623086

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 21:23:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py'], 'message': 'Fix database poison warnings, part 12

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes the last two warnings from:

    unit.compute.test_compute_api.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I8fefd8228f2aa9490cab943a79c50e76b1e66fa8
Related-Bug: #1568414
'}]
commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 12

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes the last two warnings from:

    unit.compute.test_compute_api.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I8fefd8228f2aa9490cab943a79c50e76b1e66fa8
Related-Bug: #1568414

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-13 11:28:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Switching expression order within if condition

In nova/cmd/manage.py, on line 294 [1] there is the following line:

  if value['limit'] < 0 or value['limit'] is None:

The problem occurs when value['limit'] is None, as this line tries
to compare None (object) with an integer value.

This comparsion is totally okay (without errors) in Python27.
But, if you run this on Python34, a TypError is raised:

  TypeError: unorderable types: NoneType() < int()

It is simply fixed with swapping the two expressions within the
if condition. Now if value['limit'] is None, the first expression
becomes true and second one does not get evaluated.

TrivialFix

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/cmd/manage.py#L294

Change-Id: Id2b1ed67e1c2c9f1d1aa5a23740db2b18e2e7141
"}]
commit_message:
Switching expression order within if condition

In nova/cmd/manage.py, on line 294 [1] there is the following line:

  if value['limit'] < 0 or value['limit'] is None:

The problem occurs when value['limit'] is None, as this line tries
to compare None (object) with an integer value.

This comparsion is totally okay (without errors) in Python27.
But, if you run this on Python34, a TypError is raised:

  TypeError: unorderable types: NoneType() < int()

It is simply fixed with swapping the two expressions within the
if condition. Now if value['limit'] is None, the first expression
becomes true and second one does not get evaluated.

TrivialFix

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/cmd/manage.py#L294

Change-Id: Id2b1ed67e1c2c9f1d1aa5a23740db2b18e2e7141

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-09-07 17:59:50.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conf/pxe.py', 'devstack/lib/ironic', 'releasenotes/notes/ipxe-use-swift-5ccf490daab809cc.yaml', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_pxe.py'], 'message': 'Allow using TempURLs for deploy images

when iPXE is enabled, it is possible for the bootloader to download
the deploy kernel and ramdisk directly from Swift TempURL instead of
downloading them to conductor and serving from local HTTP server.

This patch adds the required logic and a new config option
`ipxe_use_swift` (default False), setting which to True enables
using Swift TempURLs for deploy ramdisk and kernel.

Note that local caching and serving for kernel and ramdisk of user image
is still performed for partition images that require non-local boot,
as moving those to use TempURLs will make it impossible for the user
to reboot the instance when TempURLs time out or image is deleted from
Glance/Swift.

Change-Id: I106cc6148c329e784bfbb5019fdfeb0509a9de09
Closes-Bug: #1526404
Co-Authored-By: Andrey Shestakov <ashestakov@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Allow using TempURLs for deploy images

when iPXE is enabled, it is possible for the bootloader to download
the deploy kernel and ramdisk directly from Swift TempURL instead of
downloading them to conductor and serving from local HTTP server.

This patch adds the required logic and a new config option
`ipxe_use_swift` (default False), setting which to True enables
using Swift TempURLs for deploy ramdisk and kernel.

Note that local caching and serving for kernel and ramdisk of user image
is still performed for partition images that require non-local boot,
as moving those to use TempURLs will make it impossible for the user
to reboot the instance when TempURLs time out or image is deleted from
Glance/Swift.

Change-Id: I106cc6148c329e784bfbb5019fdfeb0509a9de09
Closes-Bug: #1526404
Co-Authored-By: Andrey Shestakov <ashestakov@mirantis.com>

Related-Bug: #1620692

commit_message:
Warn when using scheduler with debug mode

Because running with debug will cause a lot of extra logging, this will
cause negative performance in the scheduler. We should warn when
starting the scheduler service if debug is enabled.

Change-Id: I642c1f07d219c8e15c3f7ab96bf432c97ff30683

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-12 13:22:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_flavors.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNotNone() instead of assertIsNot(None,)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions.As a result, assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred over
and assertIsNot(None, ...).

Change-Id: I8a4de5d2786a44f68a951a3e06ce426fc19e1aff
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNotNone() instead of assertIsNot(None,)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions.As a result, assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred over
and assertIsNot(None, ...).

Change-Id: I8a4de5d2786a44f68a951a3e06ce426fc19e1aff

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-18 08:53:52.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/parameters.yaml'], 'message': 'doc: fix disk=0 use case in flavor doc

The 0 value of the disk parameter of the flavor is only meaningfull
if the instance is booted from volume as in any other case the
instance will use local disk and the scheduler will not be
able to select the hosts based on the real image size as that
information is not available for the scheduler.

Change-Id: I6b3ba2fb323341071eae6b9e9f54ef833fdbaff7
Closes-Bug: #1599787
DocImpact: admin guide
'}]
commit_message:
doc: fix disk=0 use case in flavor doc

The 0 value of the disk parameter of the flavor is only meaningfull
if the instance is booted from volume as in any other case the
instance will use local disk and the scheduler will not be
able to select the hosts based on the real image size as that
information is not available for the scheduler.

Change-Id: I6b3ba2fb323341071eae6b9e9f54ef833fdbaff7
Closes-Bug: #1599787
DocImpact: admin guide

subject: Turn on F812 check

   F812 list comprehension redefines <variable> from line ...

While the current violations were benign, this sort of code can easily

Change-Id: Ibdcf9f93b85a1f1411198001df6bdbfa8f92d114
'}]
commit_message:
Turn on F812 check

   F812 list comprehension redefines <variable> from line ...

While the current violations were benign, this sort of code can easily
lead to subtle bugs. Seems worth checking, especially given how cheap it
is to bring existing code in line with it.

Change-Id: Ibdcf9f93b85a1f1411198001df6bdbfa8f92d114

subject: Remove the previous plan when deploying
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-19 08:19:45.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/workflows/plan_management.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Remove the previous plan when deploying

The `openstack overcloud deploy` command currently attempts to "reset" a plan
when it deploys, this is for backwards compatibility. Having plans be used
behind the scenes in the command shouldn't change the behaviour of the
command.

There are various problems with updating plans. This is a workaround that
resolves them until we can better evaluate, design and implement a good system
for updating plans. https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1623431

TODO: This wont fully work yet, as tripleo-common wont let us delete plans
      with a Heat stack of the same name. So if the stack exists, this will
      fail.

Partial-Bug: #1622683
Change-Id: I3b3482b405c7c1c2156f5c6691324a843a3a7131
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the previous plan when deploying

The `openstack overcloud deploy` command currently attempts to "reset" a plan
when it deploys, this is for backwards compatibility. Having plans be used
behind the scenes in the command shouldn't change the behaviour of the
command.

There are various problems with updating plans. This is a workaround that
resolves them until we can better evaluate, design and implement a good system
for updating plans. https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1623431

TODO: This wont fully work yet, as tripleo-common wont let us delete plans
      with a Heat stack of the same name. So if the stack exists, this will
      fail.

Partial-Bug: #1622683
Change-Id: I3b3482b405c7c1c2156f5c6691324a843a3a7131

commit_message:
Fix link reference in Nova API version

This patch replaces link reference in "API Guide/ Links
and Reference" in [1] from [2] to [3].
[2] leads to a wrong link (error 404 not found).
[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/v2/
links_and_references.html
[3] http://developer.openstack.org/api-guide/compute/
links_and_references.html

Closes-Bug: #1615467
Change-Id: I10a0520cb0233114c30a6e34ef927ee74bf3cf4c

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-19 00:43:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'Disable DHCP on agent port removal

The previous logic was just ripping the interface out without
stopping dnsmasq. This would lead to a file handle remaining to the
interface which would cause OVS to completely freak out and assign
the same ofport to multiple ports.

This preserves the behavior introduced in
I40b85033d075562c43ce4d0e68296211b3241197 but just fully disables

resync.

Closes-bug: #1624701
Change-Id: Icdd9ac136eeb3707c912853b134dbb58109e6940
'}]
commit_message:
Disable DHCP on agent port removal

The previous logic was just ripping the interface out without
stopping dnsmasq. This would lead to a file handle remaining to the
interface which would cause OVS to completely freak out and assign
the same ofport to multiple ports.

This preserves the behavior introduced in
I40b85033d075562c43ce4d0e68296211b3241197 but just fully disables
DHCP rather than relying on an exception generation to cause the
resync.

Closes-bug: #1624701
Change-Id: Icdd9ac136eeb3707c912853b134dbb58109e6940

subject: Don't warn in VLAN Plumber on tagless children
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-15 06:16:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/trunk/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/trunk_plumber.py'], 'message': "Don't warn in VLAN Plumber on tagless children

The VLAN Plumber VLAN parsing was warning on lines that had
parent interfaces but were missing 802.1Q tags. This was warning
on veth pairs and bridge interfaces, which was silly. This
adjusts the logic to handle those without warning.

Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: I4a78e7bce2883f6ca77c18bd388c03c99b8d0ae1
"}]
commit_message:
Don't warn in VLAN Plumber on tagless children

The VLAN Plumber VLAN parsing was warning on lines that had
parent interfaces but were missing 802.1Q tags. This was warning
on veth pairs and bridge interfaces, which was silly. This
adjusts the logic to handle those without warning.

Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: I4a78e7bce2883f6ca77c18bd388c03c99b8d0ae1

subject: Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-12 09:57:54.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/oneview/test_deploy.py'], 'message': "Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittesttools, assertDictEqual() and assertEqual()
are implemented by using '!=' operator. But assertEqual()
can handle dict, list, set and so on. So we just call
assertEqual() to make the tests simpler.

Change-Id: Id59455c036f27130778a40fd791e52e5933c4813
"}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittesttools, assertDictEqual() and assertEqual()
are implemented by using '!=' operator. But assertEqual()
can handle dict, list, set and so on. So we just call
assertEqual() to make the tests simpler.

Change-Id: Id59455c036f27130778a40fd791e52e5933c4813

subject: Upgrade scripts to migrate aodh alarm data
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-17 12:40:06.000000000', 'files': ['environments/major-upgrade-aodh-migration.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/mitaka_to_newton_aodh_data_migration.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/aodh_data_migration.sh'], 'message': "Upgrade scripts to migrate aodh alarm data

In Newton, Aodh will be using its own mysql DB rather than
using ceilometer's mongo instance. This means we need to
migrate any existing alarm and alrm history data from
ceilometer DB to aodh mysqlDB. Upstream aodh provides us
with a aodh-data-migration utility. We need to invoke this
during the mitaka->newton upgrade procedure so data is
migrated as expected and aodh mysql backend takes over.

Closes-bug: #1611794

Change-Id: I17888b57ecf98cd83e92af2f9cdbead066b03aa3
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrade scripts to migrate aodh alarm data

In Newton, Aodh will be using its own mysql DB rather than
using ceilometer's mongo instance. This means we need to
migrate any existing alarm and alrm history data from
ceilometer DB to aodh mysqlDB. Upstream aodh provides us
with a aodh-data-migration utility. We need to invoke this
during the mitaka->newton upgrade procedure so data is
migrated as expected and aodh mysql backend takes over.

Closes-bug: #1611794

Change-Id: I17888b57ecf98cd83e92af2f9cdbead066b03aa3

This parts lived in roles-deploy.sh which should retire now that roles
are completely outside of oooq but also integral part of it as 'extras'.

It also adds a proper call for the new dev mode release when running
dlrn-gate.

To avoid CI errors removal of roles-deploy.sh will be a separate change

commit_message:
Add all the gating functionality to full-deploy.sh

This parts lived in roles-deploy.sh which should retire now that roles
are completely outside of oooq but also integral part of it as 'extras'.

It also adds a proper call for the new dev mode release when running
dlrn-gate.

To avoid CI errors removal of roles-deploy.sh will be a separate change
after we altered the JJB files to use full-deploy.sh.

Change-Id: Ib9bc1bfcf2c034f4c1083abb0287dd6c8a3f2203

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-09-17 08:07:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Add members in InstanceGroup object members field

In InstanceGroup object, add_members method doesn't add members
into object members field, which causes
objects.Quotas.count(server_group_members) won't increase, and
instance group quota check invalid. This makes an issue that user
could spawn with one call more instances in server group than
was allowed in quota_server_group_members is it was below
instances quota settting.

Co-authored-by: yuntongjin <yuntong.jin@intel.com>

Change-Id: Icdd8aef688776f00fef6ede6e1bed01af29f9917
Closes-bug: #1538169
"}]
commit_message:
Add members in InstanceGroup object members field

In InstanceGroup object, add_members method doesn't add members
into object members field, which causes
objects.Quotas.count(server_group_members) won't increase, and
instance group quota check invalid. This makes an issue that user
could spawn with one call more instances in server group than
was allowed in quota_server_group_members is it was below
instances quota settting.

Co-authored-by: yuntongjin <yuntong.jin@intel.com>

Change-Id: Icdd8aef688776f00fef6ede6e1bed01af29f9917
Closes-bug: #1538169

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-14 11:37:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/test_engine_worker.py', 'heat/tests/test_convg_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/engine/worker.py'], 'message': 'Fix sync point delete

When a resource failed, the stack state was set to FAILED and current
traversal was set to emoty string. The actual traversal was lost and
there was no way to delete the sync points belonging to the actual
traversal.

This change keeps the current traversal when you do a state set, so that
later you can delete the sync points belonging to it. Also, the current
traversal is set to empty when the stack has failed and there is no need
to rollback.

Closes-Bug: #1618155

Change-Id: Iec3922af92b70b0628fb94b7b2d597247e6d42c4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sync point delete

When a resource failed, the stack state was set to FAILED and current
traversal was set to emoty string. The actual traversal was lost and
there was no way to delete the sync points belonging to the actual
traversal.

This change keeps the current traversal when you do a state set, so that
later you can delete the sync points belonging to it. Also, the current
traversal is set to empty when the stack has failed and there is no need
to rollback.

Closes-Bug: #1618155

Change-Id: Iec3922af92b70b0628fb94b7b2d597247e6d42c4

commit_message:
Graph list now working for all levels, not only cluster

Before this patch it was possible only to view list of graphs
that are related to cluster level of given env and no more.

Now graphs list for env is returning all graphs
related to it (release, plugins and cluster level).

Now the following commands are possible:

fuel2 graph list [--env ENV_ID] [--cluster] [--plugins] [--release]

All options working as filter narrowing list to the given environment
related graphs and/or graphs levels.

Change-Id: I006cf6767a9bf0d89af5026728bd13ddc42c4aa8
Partial-Bug: #1563851
Closes-Bug: #1621585

subject: Add a filter to rate limit logs
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-09-19 13:09:46.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/_options.py', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_rate_limit.py', 'requirements.txt', 'oslo_log/log.py', 'oslo_log/rate_limit.py'], 'message': 'Add a filter to rate limit logs

* Add configuration options to enable rate limiting:

  - rate_limit_interval
  - rate_limit_burst
  - rate_limit_except_level

* Add oslo_log.rate_limit submodule
* Add public functins:

  - install_filter(burst, interval, except_level)
  - uninstall_filter()

* Add unit tests
* Add a new dependency, monotonic, to get a monotonic clock

Default: rate limiting is disabled and logs at CRITICAL level are not
rate limited.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ic58dafceefde1b109721a58631c223522bf4cc9c
'}]
commit_message:
Add a filter to rate limit logs

* Add configuration options to enable rate limiting:

  - rate_limit_interval
  - rate_limit_burst
  - rate_limit_except_level

* Add oslo_log.rate_limit submodule
* Add public functins:

  - install_filter(burst, interval, except_level)
  - uninstall_filter()

* Add unit tests
* Add a new dependency, monotonic, to get a monotonic clock

Default: rate limiting is disabled and logs at CRITICAL level are not
rate limited.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ic58dafceefde1b109721a58631c223522bf4cc9c

commit_message:
Add 9.1 with liberty upgrade levels

All environments which are created on the 9.1 Fuel Master node have
fuel_version is equal to 9.1. This release have to be added in
UPGRADE_LEVELS with the 'liberty' compatibility to support N+1 and N+2
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ic4cd045e6d428ce5cfed65f385a689629a232332
Closes-Bug: #1625083

commit_message:
Updates Ubuntu Mesos build

* Adds a script to install dependancies when building the Ubuntu
  Mesos image (used in OpenStack infra)
* Fixes Dockerfile to build the Ubuntu Mesos image
  (it was missing components to add Heat agent in the image)
* Changes the name of the Mesos Ubunutu image because the Ubuntu
  version and Mesos version has changed
* Fixes a broken link in the doc

Change-Id: I35ffd4bd358a62dd7cf0d0e485b531a36b6c262b

subject: Construct a list of test cases instead of passing a regexp
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4727, 'name': 'Itzik Brown', 'email': 'itzikb@redhat.com', 'username': 'itzikb1'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-09-19 12:26:09.000000000', 'files': ['os_testr/ostestr.py', 'os_testr/testlist_builder.py', 'os_testr/tests/testlist_builder.py'], 'message': 'Construct a list of test cases instead of passing a regexp

The way how we handled the regular expressions had a lot of
limitation.

 - We are not able to pass huge arguments to testr, it makes
   difficult to have long list if accepted and/or rejected test cases,
   but we can pass a path to a file of test cases,
   which can be arbitrary big.
 - How we wanted to handle the backlists before was not worked together
   with the regular selecting regex because it consumed the pattern.
   Now the blacklisting happens in a separated phase after the selecting
   regex search.

This change just allows the new code path to run when both
 a blacklist_file and a selecting regexp specified.

The new way depends on the usual test discovery and just
filters the output of the discovery command,
this strategy can be the default in the future, now I just
wanted to preserve the old behavior as much as possible in
all the other cases.

Change-Id: Ie8e5928e286d0c9076c4eee23319149c9869a6fa
Closes-Bug: #1506215
'}]
commit_message:
Construct a list of test cases instead of passing a regexp

The way how we handled the regular expressions had a lot of
limitation.

 - We are not able to pass huge arguments to testr, it makes
   difficult to have long list if accepted and/or rejected test cases,
   but we can pass a path to a file of test cases,
   which can be arbitrary big.
 - How we wanted to handle the backlists before was not worked together
   with the regular selecting regex because it consumed the pattern.
   Now the blacklisting happens in a separated phase after the selecting
   regex search.

This change just allows the new code path to run when both
 a blacklist_file and a selecting regexp specified.

The new way depends on the usual test discovery and just
filters the output of the discovery command,
this strategy can be the default in the future, now I just
wanted to preserve the old behavior as much as possible in
all the other cases.

Change-Id: Ie8e5928e286d0c9076c4eee23319149c9869a6fa
Closes-Bug: #1506215

commit_message:
Include journal in the outputted logs

Even though the journal is large and can't be seen with an editor, we
can download it and use journalctl to read it. This file can often
contain more information relevant to debugging CI failures.

Change-Id: I3605bc77141131f1b459bc7bcfb290eb1d27c919

commit_message:
Use osd_pool_default_* puppet parameters when creating the pools

While it is possible to override the pg_num, pgp_num and size for
each pool, the defaults are hardcoded. This patch uses as default
the values given via ceph::profile::params::osd_pool_default_*
parameters, if any.

Closes-Bug: 1623590
Change-Id: Iecde772e7f72fd9abedb54cff4b8f2605df8fedd

subject: Separate Package['ceph'] from ::ceph init
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-16 20:11:44.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/package.pp'], 'message': "Separate Package['ceph'] from ::ceph init

The ::ceph class was witten to deploy and configure a new cluster.
It also defines Package['ceph'].  Ceph classes requireing Package['ceph']
are under the assumption the cluster is being built or rebuilt. It
does not allow for making run time adds to a operating cluster.
Example: ::ceph::key needs Package['ceph'] which is defined in ::ceph
which is written to create or update a cluster. However, ::ceph::key
should be able to add a key to an existing cluster without updating the
configuration.

With this patch this puppet script will a key to an existing cluster:
include ::ceph::package

ceph::key { 'client.kds':
  secret         => 'AQDbeuhW3Vi2NRAAretqPqbgTyzSfMluzohtuQ==',
  cap_mon        => 'allow *',
  cap_osd        => 'allow *',
  inject         => true,
}

Change-Id: Ifd91b4db32173f0e97ff68b5f7b6f6fceb58ceae
"}]
commit_message:
Separate Package['ceph'] from ::ceph init

The ::ceph class was witten to deploy and configure a new cluster.
It also defines Package['ceph'].  Ceph classes requireing Package['ceph']
are under the assumption the cluster is being built or rebuilt. It
does not allow for making run time adds to a operating cluster.
Example: ::ceph::key needs Package['ceph'] which is defined in ::ceph
which is written to create or update a cluster. However, ::ceph::key
should be able to add a key to an existing cluster without updating the
configuration.

With this patch this puppet script will a key to an existing cluster:
include ::ceph::package

ceph::key { 'client.kds':
  secret         => 'AQDbeuhW3Vi2NRAAretqPqbgTyzSfMluzohtuQ==',
  cap_mon        => 'allow *',
  cap_osd        => 'allow *',
  inject         => true,
}

Change-Id: Ifd91b4db32173f0e97ff68b5f7b6f6fceb58ceae

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-28 22:25:27.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/ceph.pp', 'manifests/keystone.pp'], 'message': 'Configure Ceph RGW to use Keyston V3

This patch will configure Ceph RGW, configure keystone
RGW currently uses PKI keys to verify revocation lists.
openstack_integration::keystone::enable_pki_setup must be
set to true

openstack_integration::keystone {
.
.
  enable_pki_setup => true,
}
openstack_integration::ceph {
  deploy_rgw => true,
}

Change-Id: Ic6233fc13438652343c57a3185e5054db97d248c
Depends-on: Ifb24615372c962b9e264167888d8da939b46341d
'}]
commit_message:
Configure Ceph RGW to use Keyston V3

This patch will configure Ceph RGW, configure keystone
RGW currently uses PKI keys to verify revocation lists.
openstack_integration::keystone::enable_pki_setup must be
set to true

openstack_integration::keystone {
.
.
  enable_pki_setup => true,
}
openstack_integration::ceph {
  deploy_rgw => true,
}

Change-Id: Ic6233fc13438652343c57a3185e5054db97d248c
Depends-on: Ifb24615372c962b9e264167888d8da939b46341d

subject: Revert timeout setting on paramiko.Channel
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-09-19 14:30:58.000000000', 'files': ['devops/helpers/ssh_client.py', 'devops/tests/helpers/test_ssh_client.py', 'devops/helpers/exec_result.py'], 'message': "Revert timeout setting on paramiko.Channel

Revert timeout setting on paramiko.Channel
due to received socket errors in several cases.
Enforce read data after exit status anyway as flag 'ready'
is not set.
Do not set flags on paramiko file: it's not real file or socket.
Decode: add errors='backslashreplace'
  after investigation on real snapshot

Closes-bug: #1623961
Change-Id: I4355bf8533a038f584af8b56a8ef9c708f910b3c
"}]
commit_message:
Revert timeout setting on paramiko.Channel

Revert timeout setting on paramiko.Channel
due to received socket errors in several cases.
Enforce read data after exit status anyway as flag 'ready'
is not set.
Do not set flags on paramiko file: it's not real file or socket.
Decode: add errors='backslashreplace'
  after investigation on real snapshot

Closes-bug: #1623961
Change-Id: I4355bf8533a038f584af8b56a8ef9c708f910b3c

commit_message:
Limit CentOS SIG Storage support to Ceph hammer

This patch will cause ceph::repo to fail if enable_sig is true
and release is not hammer. This check can be removed once
CentOS SIG Storage supports Ceph Jewl.
See: https://bugs.centos.org/view.php?id=10803

Change-Id: I6fc6006d94c5f559cb1b4f27e1df50cf0f551de4
Depneds-On: I8843b021374089639cfec4f7a0cd9eeed549042c

subject: Fix bootstrap-host authorized_key transfer for multi-nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-19 04:13:21.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_ssh_keys.yml'], 'message': "Fix bootstrap-host authorized_key transfer for multi-nodes

This ensures the lookup has something to lookup and doesn't assume
that the operation will run as in the root folder by default. This
assumption was fine for an AIO, but the process has to be done
differently for multi nodes.

Change-Id: Ia4121ebe8b4d64fd81ce779330d659bb954e4079
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bootstrap-host authorized_key transfer for multi-nodes

This ensures the lookup has something to lookup and doesn't assume
that the operation will run as in the root folder by default. This
assumption was fine for an AIO, but the process has to be done
differently for multi nodes.

Change-Id: Ia4121ebe8b4d64fd81ce779330d659bb954e4079
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    unit.api.openstack.compute.test_keypairs.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I4284dd7ecb9c60834dba662838f67d9defc798e2
Related-Bug: #1568414
'}]
commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 9

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    unit.api.openstack.compute.test_keypairs.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I4284dd7ecb9c60834dba662838f67d9defc798e2
Related-Bug: #1568414

subject: Revert "Improve validation for some functions"
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-12 14:40:22.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py', 'heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/engine/translation.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Improve validation for some functions"

This reverts commit 36bf170f347f927fd7f20b5868dc686041081862.

The construction and validation phases of intrinsic functions are
deliberately separated, to:

- Reduce the amount of unnecessary work done
- Reduce the risk of changes to validation breaking the loading of existing
  stacks from the database
- Ensure that the most critical errors are reported to the user first

This patch reverts a commit that sought to combine the two phases. There
was no linked bug and no explanation other than that this 'improved'
things.

It does not, however, restore the check for the Removed function during
properties translation (and the associated test), because I believe its
original existence was based on a misconception. There is no way in
practice for a hot.functions.Removed object to appear in the properties a
translation rule is operating on.

Change-Id: I59d02e540771baf4fe078081cd0993a3251eb9a6
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Improve validation for some functions"

This reverts commit 36bf170f347f927fd7f20b5868dc686041081862.

The construction and validation phases of intrinsic functions are
deliberately separated, to:

- Reduce the amount of unnecessary work done
- Reduce the risk of changes to validation breaking the loading of existing
  stacks from the database
- Ensure that the most critical errors are reported to the user first

This patch reverts a commit that sought to combine the two phases. There
was no linked bug and no explanation other than that this 'improved'
things.

It does not, however, restore the check for the Removed function during
properties translation (and the associated test), because I believe its
original existence was based on a misconception. There is no way in
practice for a hot.functions.Removed object to appear in the properties a
translation rule is operating on.

Change-Id: I59d02e540771baf4fe078081cd0993a3251eb9a6

subject: Don't log locked resource at ERROR level
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-16 17:45:46.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Don't log locked resource at ERROR level

It's expected that during a convergence traversal, we may encounter a
resource that is still locked by a previous traversal. Don't log an
ERROR-level message about what is a normal condition. Instead, log at
INFO level describing what is happening, with more details at DEBUG
level.

Change-Id: I645c2a173b828d4a983ba874037d059ee645955f
Related-Bug: #1607814
(cherry picked from commit 7f5bd76f7a14ad67b1c8e38061b316dfc509d881)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log locked resource at ERROR level

It's expected that during a convergence traversal, we may encounter a
resource that is still locked by a previous traversal. Don't log an
ERROR-level message about what is a normal condition. Instead, log at
INFO level describing what is happening, with more details at DEBUG
level.

Change-Id: I645c2a173b828d4a983ba874037d059ee645955f
Related-Bug: #1607814
(cherry picked from commit 7f5bd76f7a14ad67b1c8e38061b316dfc509d881)

subject: Don't acquire the lock when cancelling a stack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-16 21:30:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_update.py', 'heat/engine/stack_lock.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': "Don't acquire the lock when cancelling a stack

We used to try to acquire the stack lock in order to find out which engine
to cancel a running update on, in the misguided belief that it could never
succeed. Accordingly, we never released the lock.

Since it is entirely possible to encounter a race where the lock has
already been released, use the get_engine_id() method instead to look up
the ID of the engine holding the lock without attempting to acquire it.

Change-Id: I1d026f8c67dddcf840ccbc2f3f1537693dc266fb
Closes-Bug: #1624538
"}]
commit_message:
Don't acquire the lock when cancelling a stack

We used to try to acquire the stack lock in order to find out which engine
to cancel a running update on, in the misguided belief that it could never
succeed. Accordingly, we never released the lock.

Since it is entirely possible to encounter a race where the lock has
already been released, use the get_engine_id() method instead to look up
the ID of the engine holding the lock without attempting to acquire it.

Change-Id: I1d026f8c67dddcf840ccbc2f3f1537693dc266fb
Closes-Bug: #1624538

commit_message:
Add neutron-fwaas in-tree documentation

One of the requirements[1] for Neutron stadium projects is to have
in-tree developer documentation.  This creates a stub for that.  We can
expand on it once the stub is in, but this will permit us to set up
publishing while we iterate on it.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/stadium/governance.html#checklist

Change-Id: I914c0e9405385cbcda54c90f9a95275fbc105afd

commit_message:
Fix of verify_glance_api_versions

verify_glance_api_versions was used .get_versions() method which is
work correctly only for RestClient and not applicable to child with
defined property api_version. Now it's switched to _get_api_versions
method.

Change-Id: Ie5e7b384d3a661f22b3f1d16ffca2beeb41de954
Partial-Bug: 1611771

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-10 11:51:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/vmware/test_vmware_vmdk.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmdk.py', 'releasenotes/notes/vmdk_backup_restore-41f807b7bc8e0ae8.yaml'], 'message': 'VMware: Send additional connection info

Change I743e676372703e74178c79683dd622d530981e04 removed volume
backend driver calls for creating and restoring volume backups.
The overridden methods for creating and restoring backups in
the VMDK driver is no longer called and this breaks the backup-
restore of volumes created by the VMDK driver. Now backup and
restore of volumes use os-brick connectors.

Change Ia1a20f93780593b1efbb74484c3fdd3ca3564290 added a new
connector in os-brick to support vmdk volumes. The new vmdk
connector requires additional connection info so that it can
connect to vCenter server and access the volume vmdk to perform
volume connect and disconnect.

Closes-bug: #1602660
Change-Id: I66a30366ccdae74e13f7a0e35cd7bfdfed2785be
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Send additional connection info

Change I743e676372703e74178c79683dd622d530981e04 removed volume
backend driver calls for creating and restoring volume backups.
The overridden methods for creating and restoring backups in
the VMDK driver is no longer called and this breaks the backup-
restore of volumes created by the VMDK driver. Now backup and
restore of volumes use os-brick connectors.

Change Ia1a20f93780593b1efbb74484c3fdd3ca3564290 added a new
connector in os-brick to support vmdk volumes. The new vmdk
connector requires additional connection info so that it can
connect to vCenter server and access the volume vmdk to perform
volume connect and disconnect.

Closes-bug: #1602660
Change-Id: I66a30366ccdae74e13f7a0e35cd7bfdfed2785be

commit_message:
Scalable Clearwater demo app

This patch introduce Scalable Application Framework
in Clearwater components
* Scripts honor instance index
* Instances replaced to TemplateServerGrops
* Scale Out action possible
Also bugfixes in Bind application
* Dashboard honors instance naming pattern
* DNSSEC key shold be encoded (to prevent re-encoding every deploy)

Change-Id: Icbdad5b1a2b41591af0aa241a069309783d0b5ab
Targets: bp clearwater-vims-implementation
Depends-On: I16c69010d5e7c661bd2cb172da6f3aece4aac55c

commit_message:
Retain apt sources options during host bootstrap

When running the bootstrap-host playbook for an AIO install, the
apt/sources.list file is rewritten. Update the tasks determining
existing repos to make sure that any options, such as specific
architectures, are included in the rewritten file.

Change-Id: I7fab8f3c072e25fa8138c3e37d764b36d17526d6

subject: Fix gate jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-19 12:43:14.000000000', 'files': ['sahara_dashboard/content/data_processing/clusters/image_registry/forms.py'], 'message': 'Fix gate jobs

After change Icca91c53eabf18c3109b3931ed53f70eaaaa0e56
method "image_list_detailed" returns list of "Image"
instances which inherit from
openstack_dashboard.api.base.APIResourceWrapper.
For getting "image_type" attribute we need to use "get"
method now.

Closes-bug: #1624318
Change-Id: Ida96baeaeef203c586498028f92db2498fa6972d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix gate jobs

After change Icca91c53eabf18c3109b3931ed53f70eaaaa0e56
method "image_list_detailed" returns list of "Image"
instances which inherit from
openstack_dashboard.api.base.APIResourceWrapper.
For getting "image_type" attribute we need to use "get"
method now.

Closes-bug: #1624318
Change-Id: Ida96baeaeef203c586498028f92db2498fa6972d

commit_message:
Add optional magnum-ui in quickstart

Add magnum-ui panel in horizon

Magnum UI plugin for horizon is nice feature for users
and can now be easily enabled in devstack.  There has been
multiple queries on the IRC on how to get the Magnum UI
so this will help.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-04 00:40:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/quota.py'], 'message': "Fix incorrect debug information about quota check

When checking quotas and trying to reserve resources
for instances, the process prints some incorrect
information to nova-api.log. This patch fixes this.

In line 533 of the code file 'nova.quota.py'
(class：DbQuotaDriver，method：reserve),
the argument 'quotas' should be 'user_quotas'.

Change-Id: If2437f15e8c562b9388883dcf7d6d326d24241ff
Closes-Bug: #1619085
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect debug information about quota check

When checking quotas and trying to reserve resources
for instances, the process prints some incorrect
information to nova-api.log. This patch fixes this.

In line 533 of the code file 'nova.quota.py'
(class：DbQuotaDriver，method：reserve),
the argument 'quotas' should be 'user_quotas'.

Change-Id: If2437f15e8c562b9388883dcf7d6d326d24241ff
Closes-Bug: #1619085

Document generate_service_certificate option for undercloud

This documents the feature to automatically generate certificates to
enable TLS for the undercloud.

subject: Remove duplicate lbaas provider config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-19 12:50:17.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/neutron/templates/neutron.conf.j2'], 'message': "Remove duplicate lbaas provider config

Option `service_provider` is defined in neutron_lbaas.conf, there
is a duplicated config option in neutron.conf, it should be removed
there. Otherwise neutron-server will not be able to start with error:
'Invalid: Driver
neutron_lbaas.drivers.haproxy.plugin_driver.HaproxyOnHostPluginDriver is
not unique across providers'

Change-Id: I3fc379535eb00bbcb23aa41de95ca8161883a181
Closes-bug: #1625174"}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicate lbaas provider config

Option `service_provider` is defined in neutron_lbaas.conf, there
is a duplicated config option in neutron.conf, it should be removed
there. Otherwise neutron-server will not be able to start with error:
'Invalid: Driver
neutron_lbaas.drivers.haproxy.plugin_driver.HaproxyOnHostPluginDriver is
not unique across providers'

Change-Id: I3fc379535eb00bbcb23aa41de95ca8161883a181
Closes-bug: #1625174

subject: Disable list_extend in config_template
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-19 09:19:15.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/disable-list-extend-3a9547de9034f9ba.yaml', 'tasks/ceilometer_post_install.yml'], 'message': 'Disable list_extend in config_template

This allow ceilometer pipelines to be fully controlled with config_template.
Previously a ceilometer pipeline would extend a nested list instead of
redefining it which can have undesirable effects. This change disables the
default list_extend property within the config_template allowing a deployer
to fully redefine a given pipeline.

Change-Id: Ibe64254dcbca99b6b720146d2d4f2a25e22236a3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Disable list_extend in config_template

This allow ceilometer pipelines to be fully controlled with config_template.
Previously a ceilometer pipeline would extend a nested list instead of
redefining it which can have undesirable effects. This change disables the
default list_extend property within the config_template allowing a deployer
to fully redefine a given pipeline.

Change-Id: Ibe64254dcbca99b6b720146d2d4f2a25e22236a3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT: Apply network MTU to VLAN ports

Through change I9b4efae620ec9f6790547c8fffc58872d43277f5
we added support in manila to request the Maximum Transmission
Unit (MTU) from the network provider (neutron, standalone, etc.).

To honor this MTU, the NetApp cDOT driver needs to apply it
to the VLAN ports (via the broadcast domain) that the LIFs of the
newly created share servers are assigned to.

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthamr@netapp.com>
Depends-On: I9b4efae620ec9f6790547c8fffc58872d43277f5
Change-Id: Ia01d982c7328feff292d54588d33a16df705f81e
Implements: blueprint netapp-cdot-honor-mtu-size

commit_message:
Release Django OpenStack Auth

The currently tagged version of Django OpenStack Auth for stable/newton
has failing tests, due to a library update. This release includes the
fix, so that translation jobs can pass successfully.

Change-Id: I856a30e73d8cbc7b1e593ebd010fef504237d4b0
